text: No shame. Just a plea for a lot more policy and a lot less conspiracy theory.

text: There are a ton of #LGBTQ kids, victims of sexual abuse, dreamers and hard-working immigrants we want to talk about participating in this America instead of #MuellerReport.

text: Is it condescending? Or is it asking journalism  to do better? I’m not doubting you care about lots of things. I’m telling you they told you to care a lot about something that didn’t really matter to folks who work hard every day.

text: This will never happen, but I do hope people look hard at themselves about what they’ve said about Mueller for the past two years. Because most of it was just utter bullshit that fomented partisan divides.
author: meganmurp

text: People care about jobs. They care about how they are going to afford to send their kids to college and pay for their parents’ nursing care. They care about being safe and their schools being better. Enough of #MuellerReport. Time for reality.
author: meganmurp

text: It’s almost as if that campaign was too stupid, morally bankrupt and inept to collude with people *actively* trying to collude with them. But, sure, let’s take two years to say that.

text: Wait there are no new indictments???  I’m totally stunned. Stunned.

text: Also super glad we spent two years of our lives on that instead of focusing resolutely on how to improve the lives of working class Americans increasingly locked out of a secure future. I’m sure they’re grateful.

text: I’m always amazed how much most journalists vastly overestimate how much most people care about this.
